ingredients:
Ingredients:

  • Eggs (2)
  • Plain flour(125g)
  • Milk (300ml)
  • Pinch of salt
  • Fresh grated nutmeg
  • Beef dripping or oil
recipe1: Yorkshire Puddings are a dish of simple ingredients, but can be tricky to cook consistently well.  All the more reason for plenty of practice!
recipe2: Sieve the flour into a large bowl, add salt and a good grating of nutmeg, then make a well in the middle.
recipe3: Beat the eggs into the milk and pour enough into the well to fill it.  Using a fork pull some of the flour into the mix and combine.  Once enough of the flour has been combined with the mix that is starts to thicken pull more flour in.
recipe4: Keep this process going until all of the flour and milk are combined then pour into a jug and chill for at least 30 minutes.  Place the pudding tray into the oven and heat to 220C.
recipe5: Once the tray is hot add the oil or dripping and return to the oven for 5 minutes.  Add the batter, return to the oven and do not open the door for at least 25 minutes.  If you like a crisp bottom turn the puddings and cook for a further 5 minutes.
aside1:
Did you know....

Cooks in northern England devised a means of making use of the fat that dropped into the dripping pan to cook a batter pudding while the meat roasted.

In 1737, a recipe for 'a dripping pudding' was published in Sir Alexander William George Cassey's book The Whole Duty of a Woman

National Yorkshire Pudding Day has been celebrated on the first Sunday in February.
